Entries.default:
"A moment of your time, Watcher... if you will."

The Steward of Caed Nua's voice rises soft and evenly from her cracked bust.
"How did a crate get onto my ship unnoticed?"

"Unfortunately the ship lacks the defensive fortifications of Caed Nua. A crate could have been slipped aboard at any of our ports of call. Assuming it wasn't placed among our goods as we took on supplies."
"It is roughly a yard to a side and labeled 'beans.' The hands who noticed it were tasked by the cook to bring up ingredients for the evening's stew."

"The hands left the crate in the hold, if you wish to examine it."

The bust falls into silence.
"Some of the hands discovered an unusual crate in the ship's hold."
"Apologies. I thought you would want to know about the crate that mysteriously appeared in your ship's hold, but if you're otherwise engaged, please do not be distracted by such trivialities."
[Leave] "Thank you, Steward. I'll go see what it is."
A wave of affirmation rolls from the Steward, the spiritual equivalent of a nod.
